intro: Cruciata verna, commonly known as spring crucifix, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that are arranged in a cross shape, giving it its common name. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and woodland edges. The leaves are linear and often hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
